p: The S gene coding for receptor-binding spike protein which is crucial for membrane fusion and transmission capacity is not very similar to pre-existing CoVs, nonetheless having an exceptional similarity to RaTG13 (93.1%) [ 39– 41]. In nCoV, there are three novel insertions in the N-terminal domain and key residues in the receptor-binding motif which are not present in SARS-CoV [ 7] and possibly, these insertions have a pivotal role in conferring sialic acid-binding activity which is the key factor in determining the pathogenicity of coronaviruses [ 7, 42– 44].
